content: The "Family Business Protection Act of 1995" is also known as the Family-Owned Business Exclusion under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This Act aims to provide protection for family-owned businesses. The Family Business Protection Act of 1995, also known as the Family-Owned Business Exclusion, excludes the adjusted value of qualified family-owned business interests from the gross estate of a decedent, with specific limitations and criteria for eligibility. The Family Business Protection Act of 1995, or the Family-Owned Business Exclusion, allows for the exclusion of qualified family-owned business interests from the gross estate of a decedent, subject to specific eligibility criteria and limitations. This includes interests acquired by a qualified heir and the adjusted taxable gifts to family members, provided certain conditions are met. The Family Business Protection Act of 1995 allows for the exclusion of qualified family-owned business interests from the gross estate of a decedent if certain conditions are met, including material participation in the business by the decedent or family members. The adjusted gross estate is calculated by deducting certain amounts and adding gifts to the spouse. The Family Business Protection Act of 1995 allows for the exclusion of qualified family-owned business interests from the gross estate of a decedent if certain conditions are met. The adjusted value of the business interest is determined by deducting certain amounts, including gifts to the spouse within 10 years of the decedent's death. Under section 163(h)(3), any indebtedness used for educational and medical expenses of the decedent, spouse, or dependents, plus any other indebtedness not exceeding $10,000, qualifies for exclusion. A qualified family-owned business interest includes proprietorship or partnership interests. Applicable rules similar to various sections apply, including rules for retired or disabled decedents, special rules for surviving spouses, partial dispositions, due dates, tax liability, and no tax under certain conditions.
